mlr3mbspls 0.2.11

Evaluate MB-sPLS on New Data (EV per block/component, MAC, scores, weights)

Source: R/mbspls_eval_new_data.R
mbspls_eval_new_data.Rd

Runs a trained mlr3 graph that contains a PipeOpMBsPLS on a new Task and returns evaluation metrics computed on the new data: block-wise explained variances per component, component-wise totals, the latent-correlation objective (MAC or Frobenius), and the block scores.

Internally, this function temporarily attaches a logging environment to the MB-sPLS node (via its log_env parameter), calls gl$predict(task), retrieves the payload written by the operator, and augments it with the trained weights/loadings/blocks from the fitted model.

This ensures perfect parity with the training/prediction implementation (deflation order, preprocessing upstream in the graph, etc.).

mbspls_eval_new_data(gl, task, mbspls_id = NULL)

Arguments

gl

(GraphLearner)
A trained graph learner containing a PipeOpMBsPLS node.

task

(Task)
An mlr3 task with new data to evaluate on. The graph's preprocessing will be applied automatically.

mbspls_id

(character(1) | NULL)
Optional id of the MB-sPLS node in the graph. If NULL (default), the first node inheriting from PipeOpMBsPLS is used. If multiple nodes are present, the first is chosen with a warning unless mbspls_id is supplied.

Value

list with the following elements (all computed on the new data):

  • ev_block (matrix [ncomp x n_blocks]): explained variance per block and component.

  • ev_comp (numeric [ncomp]): total explained variance per component (across blocks).

  • mac_comp (numeric [ncomp]): objective per component on new data (MAC or Frobenius, matching the trained operator).

  • T_mat (matrix [n_obs x (ncomp*n_blocks)]): block scores; columns ordered as LV1_<block1>, ..., LV1_<blockB>, LV2_<block1>, ....

  • blocks (character [n_blocks]): block names (for convenience).

  • weights (list): trained weights \(w_b^{(k)}\)\; list-of-lists: component -> block -> named numeric vector (feature weights).

  • loadings (list): trained loadings \(p_b^{(k)}\) used for deflation.

  • blocks_map (list): mapping block -> feature names (training).

  • ncomp (integer(1)): number of retained components.

  • perf_metric (character(1)): "mac" or "frobenius" (from training).

Details

The function does not modify the learner permanently. Any existing log_env on the MB-sPLS node is restored after the call.

Errors

An error is thrown if the graph has no PipeOpMBsPLS node, if the learner is untrained, or if the MB-sPLS node did not log a payload (e.g., because the id was wrong).

See also

mlr3pipelines::GraphLearner, PipeOpMBsPLS

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
# Assume `gl` is a trained GraphLearner with a PipeOpMBsPLS node and
# `task_new` is an mlr3::Task with new data:
res = mbspls_eval_new_data(gl, task_new)

# Per-block explained variances on new data:
res$ev_block

# Per-component totals and MAC:
res$ev_comp
res$mac_comp

# Access trained weights for LC_02, block "mri":
res$weights[["LC_02"]][["mri"]]
} # }
